quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: The only way to predict the future is to create it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Experience is the teacher of all things.
quotes.author: Julius Caesar

quotes.text: I can resist everything except temptation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I'm not lazy, I'm energy efficient.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: I'm on a whiskey diet. I've lost three days already.
quotes.author: Tommy Cooper

quotes.text: Sarcasm: the ability to insult idiots without them realizing it.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: If at first, you don't succeed, then skydiving definitely isn't for you.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.text: I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.text: I told my wife the truth. I told her I was seeing a psychiatrist. Then she told me the truth: that she was seeing a psychiatrist, two plumbers, and a bartender.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield
